items.title: Here’s how to score $1,000 savings on EcoFlow’s upcoming DELTA Pro Ultra X power station
items.summary:
Right alongside its ongoing Prime Day Sale that has been extended through October 15, EcoFlow has launched the super early-bird savings promotion for its upcoming DELTA Pro Ultra X Whole-Home Power Station (1 inverter and 2x batteries) ahead of its release on November 3, 2025. At this time, pricing information is surprisingly limited, with the brand simply offering the deal of a $500 deposit made between now and November 2, scoring you a $1,000 discount upon its launch from November 3 to November 30. The predecessor model carries a $6,098 tag at full price, with it regularly keeping under $5,000 most of the time, so it’s safe to say that this new model’s MSRP will land somewhere around those rates. Along with the initial discount, the brand is also promising up to $1,000 in installation subsidies when grabbing the station bundled with the brand’s new Smart Home Panel 3. Head below to learn more about this all-new backup power solution.

items.summary:
UGREEN M4 Mac mini Docking Station

Buy for $60 (Reg. $100)

What we love

To me, the showstopper here of this docking station is that it can house an up 8TB NVMe SSD. When building out a custom M4 Mac mini configuation from Apple, you can only go as high as 2TB, and the company wants $800 to do it. This offering will let you go much higher than that and offers up a bunch of extra ports. Plus, you’ll save a lot of money going this route too.

items.title: Bring Marshall’s Emberton II portable Bluetooth speaker anywhere for 30+ hours of playback at $95 (Reg. $130)
items.summary:
Amazon is now offering the Marshall Emberton II Portable Bluetooth Speaker at a Prime exclusive $94.99 shipped. While it sports a $170 MSRP, you’ll more regularly find it floating around $130 at full price since its newer third-generation model released, with discounts having gone as low as $95 over the year, which last popped up back during July’s Prime Day event. Last week’s Prime Big Deal Days event kept things at $100, but now you can score it back at the annual low for the second time ever. The deal gives you a 27% markdown off the going rate (44% off the MSRP), cutting $35 from the tag here, and saving you a total $75 off the MSRP that you would pay elsewhere, for another shot at the best price of 2025.
